class.name: EditorFileSystem
class.brief_description: Resource filesystem, as the editor sees it.
class.description: This object holds information of all resources in the filesystem, their types, etc. [b]Note:[/b] This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton using [method EditorInterface.get_resource_filesystem].

method.name: get_file_type
method.description: Returns the resource type of the file, given the full path. This returns a string such as [code]"Resource"[/code] or [code]"GDScript"[/code], [i]not[/i] a file extension such as [code]".gd"[/code].

method.name: get_filesystem_path
method.description: Returns a view into the filesystem at [param path].

method.name: get_scanning_progress
method.description: Returns the scan progress for 0 to 1 if the FS is being scanned.

method.name: is_scanning
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the filesystem is being scanned.

method.name: reimport_files
method.description: Reimports a set of files. Call this if these files or their [code].import[/code] files were directly edited by script or an external program. If the file type changed or the file was newly created, use [method update_file] or [method scan]. [b]Note:[/b] This function blocks until the import is finished. However, the main loop iteration, including timers and [method Node._process], will occur during the import process due to progress bar updates. Avoid calls to [method reimport_files] or [method scan] while an import is in progress.

method.name: scan_sources
method.description: Check if the source of any imported resource changed.

method.name: update_file
method.description: Add a file in an existing directory, or schedule file information to be updated on editor restart. Can be used to update text files saved by an external program. This will not import the file. To reimport, call [method reimport_files] or [method scan] methods.

signal.name: resources_reimported
signal.description: Emitted if a resource is reimported.

signal.name: resources_reload
signal.description: Emitted if at least one resource is reloaded when the filesystem is scanned.

signal.name: script_classes_updated
signal.description: Emitted when the list of global script classes gets updated.

signal.name: sources_changed
signal.description: Emitted if the source of any imported file changed.
